info.title: Loyalty Management

get.description: This operation list or find LoyaltyProgramProductSpec entities

parameters.description: Requested index for start of resources to be provided in response

post.description: Sets the communication endpoint address the service instance must use to deliver information about its health state, execution state, failures and metrics.

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: Data containing the callback endpoint to deliver the information

delete.description: Resets the communication endpoint address the service instance must use to deliver information about its health state, execution state, failures and metrics.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the registered listener

Characteristic.description: Describes a given characteristic of an object or entity through a name/value pair.

valueType.description: Data type of the value of the characteristic

@baseType.description: When sub-classing, this defines the super-class

@schemaLocation.description: A URI to a JSON-Schema file that defines additional attributes and relationships

@type.description: When sub-classing, this defines the sub-class entity name

LoyaltyAccount.description: A loyalty account, containing loyalty balances.

id.description: Unique identifier for the account.

href.description: A reference to the loyalty members loyalty account.

@baseType.description: When sub-classing, this defines the super-class

@schemaLocation.description: A URI to a JSON-Schema file that defines additional attributes and relationships

@type.description: When sub-classing, this defines the sub-class entity name

id.description: Unique identifier for the account.

href.description: A reference to the loyalty members loyalty account.

@baseType.description: When sub-classing, this defines the super-class

@schemaLocation.description: A URI to a JSON-Schema file that defines additional attributes and relationships

@type.description: When sub-classing, this defines the sub-class entity name

@referredType.description: The type of the referred entity

LoyaltyAction.description: Contains information on a loyalty action that should be applied should certain conditions be met for a loyalty rule and program.

id.description: Unique identifier for the loyalty event type.

href.description: A reference to the loyalty event type.

action.description: The HTTP operation to be used when calling the endpoint

commonName.description: A user-friendly identifier of the loyalty execution point.

description.description: A free-form description of the loyalty execution point.

endpoint.description: The endpoint to call to trigger a BusinessInteraction, CustomerOrder or LoyaltyEarn.

version.description: A string that identifies the version of the loyalty action.

actionAttributes.description: Additional attributes required to perform the action. These attributes will depend on the type of the loyalty action. For example, if it is a LoyaltyEarn action, there will be a “quantity” attribute value pair indicating how many points should be earned.

body.description: The body if the request that is made when this action i executed. The body is assumed to be of type text/json. Any tokens denoted with {} will be replaced by attributes present in: Member profile, actionAttributes or event attributes in the loyalty event request.

headers.description: The HTTP headers that is added to the action call.

@baseType.description: When sub-classing, this defines the super-class

@schemaLocation.description: A URI to a JSON-Schema file that defines additional attributes and relationships

@type.description: When sub-classing, this defines the sub-class entity name

body.description: The body if the request that is made when this action i executed. The body is assumed to be of type text/json. Any tokens denoted with {} will be replaced by attributes present in: Member profile, actionAttributes or event attributes in the loyalty event request.

headers.description: The HTTP headers that is added to the action call.

LoyaltyBalance.description: A loyalty balance, containing a balance unit and value.

id.description: Unique identifier for the loyalty balance.

href.description: A reference to the loyalty member’s loyalty balance.

loyaltyProgramMember.description: Reference to the loyaltyProgramMember to whom the loyaltyAccount belongs.

quantity.description: Unit and value of the balance.

validFor.description: The validity period in which loyalty can be burned using the account.

LoyaltyEventType.description: An event type used to match filter incoming loyalty events.

id.description: Unique identifier for the loyalty event type.

href.description: A reference to the loyalty event type.

eventType.description: The type of loyalty event expected to trigger the loyalty rule evaluation, e.g. a CustomerOrder or an Invoice. The eventType should be unique to prevent existing resources not being reused. An eventType that already exists will result in a 422 error.

LoyaltyProgramMember.description: A person or group that opts in to a loyalty program.

id.description: Unique identifier for the loyalty program member.

href.description: A reference to the loyalty program member.

status.description: A free-form field in which the members status may be captured, e.g. [active], [suspended], .etc.

ValidFor.description: The period during which the loyalty member is valid for.

LoyaltyProgramProduct.description: An instance of a loyalty program specification, linked to a specified loyalty member.

id.description: Unique identifier for the loyalty program product.

href.description: A reference to the loyalty account.

description.description: An explanation of what the product is.

name.description: A word, term, or phrase by which the product is known and distinguished from other products.

productStatus.description: The condition of the product, such as planned, designed, activated, disconnected.

characteristic.description: Name value pairs of product characteristics.

LoyaltyProgramProductSpecRef.description: A reference to a loyalty program specification.

id.description: Unique identifier for the product specification.

href.description: A reference to the product specification.

@baseType.description: When sub-classing, this defines the super-class

@schemaLocation.description: A URI to a JSON-Schema file that defines additional attributes and relationships

@type.description: When sub-classing, this defines the sub-class entity name

@referredType.description: The type of the referred entity

LoyaltyRule.description: Loyalty rule, containing conditions, event types and actions.

id.description: Unique identifier for the loyalty rule.

href.description: A reference to the loyalty rule.

commonName.description: A user-friendly identifier of the loyalty rule.

description.description: A free-form description of the rule.

hasSubRules.description: A Boolean attribute that signifies whether this loyalty rule has one or more sub-rules. Sub-rules are used to enforce a hierarchical nesting of rules, so that parent rules may control the execution and other semantics of sub-rules that they contain.

isCNF.description: This is a Boolean attribute that, if true, defines the condition clause of this rule to be represented in Conjunctive Normal Form (e.g., an AND of ORs). If the value of this attribute is false, then the condition clause will be represented in Disjunctive Normal Form (e.g., an OR of ANDs).

isMandatoryEvaluation.description: A Boolean attribute that, if true, signifies that evaluation (and possibly action execution) of this entity is mandatory and must be attempted. If the Mandatory property value of this entity is false, then the evaluation of this entity is considered to be 'best effort' and may be ignored.

keywords.description: A string attribute that defines a set of one or more keywords that a policy administrator may use to assist in characterizing or categorizing a policy object to facilitate search operations.

policyName.description: A generic naming attribute that can be used to identify different policy entities.

usage.description: A free-form string attribute that recommends how this policy object should be used.

@baseType.description: When sub-classing, this defines the super-class

Money.description: A base / value business entity used to represent money

unit.description: Currency (ISO4217 norm uses 3 letters to define the currency)

TimePeriod.description: A period of time, either as a deadline (endDateTime only) a startDateTime only, or both

endDateTime.description: End of the time period, using IETC-RFC-3339 format

startDateTime.description: Start of the time period, using IETC-RFC-3339 format. If you define a start, you must also define an end

EventSubscription.description: Sets the communication endpoint address the service instance must use to deliver notification information

id.description: Id of the listener

EventSubscriptionInput.description: Sets the communication endpoint address the service instance must use to deliver notification information

Error.description: Used when an API throws an Error, typically with a HTTP error response-code (3xx, 4xx, 5xx)

code.description: Application relevant detail, defined in the API or a common list.

reason.description: Explanation of the reason for the error which can be shown to a client user.

message.description: More details and corrective actions related to the error which can be shown to a client user.

referenceError.description: URI of documentation describing the error.
